DataElement.preferredName: Testicular Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Regional Lymph Node N Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for testicular carcinoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor Pathologic N Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A malignant germ cell tumor that arises from the testis. It predominantly affects young men. Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CRF standard harmonization. mc 1/31/17

ValueDomain.preferredName: Testicular Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Pathologic N Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of testicular cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer with metastasis with a lymph node mass larger than 5 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer with metastasis with a lymph node mass larger than 5 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer with metastasis with a lymph node mass larger than 2 cm but not larger than 5 cm in greatest dimension; or more than five nodes positive, none larger than 5 cm; or evidence of extranodal extension of tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer with metastasis with a lymph node mass larger than 2 cm but not larger than 5 cm in greatest dimension; or more than five nodes positive, none larger than 5 cm; or evidence of extranodal extension of tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer with metastasis with a lymph node mass 2 cm or smaller in greatest dimension and less than or equal to five nodes positive, none larger than 2 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer with metastasis with a lymph node mass 2 cm or smaller in greatest dimension and less than or equal to five nodes positive, none larger than 2 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer with no regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer with no regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Testicular Cancer Pathologic TNM Finding v8 American Joint Committee on Cancer N Category Category
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of testicular cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system.:A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.:One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer Pathologic TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of testicular cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
